intro: Pelargonium sessiliflorum, commonly known as the purple-leafed geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark purple foliage and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance and ability to attract pollinators. Pelargonium sessiliflorum is also known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
